class_notes:
Course Aims and Goals: This is an intermediate Greek reading course. The primary goal is to read, comment on selections from the Greek New Testament and the Septuagint (the Greek version of the Old Testament). The general aim is the deepening and extension of students' reading knowledge of ancient Greek literature. Exposure to as much Greek writing as possible, within the framework of regular, weekly meetings is designed to take competence and confidence in Greek reading to high levels.
Content: This selection will be passages across the Greek Old and New Testaments. Participants will prepare the specified passages ahead of meetings and read through these together with the instructor.
course_description: Topic changes to meet current interest of students and faculty. Course may be repeated for credit as topic varies.
